item.title: Hey, hey, hey, it's a new site!
item.description: After a few years of barely changing anything on my site, I’m super happy to finally build a whole new site! ğŸ‰ This site is powered by Hugo & Tailwind CSS. It’s been super fun to build, and I’m excited to finally get back to writing some blog posts. I’ve recently been updating a few of my other sites, and it feels good to use some sleek new tools to do it.

item.title: About Brad Parbs

item.title: Contact
item.description: There are plenty of ways to contact & follow me. I currently use Github, Twitter, and LinkedIn. And of course, you can always email me.

item.title: A Beginnerâ€™s Guide to the Best Command Line Tools
item.description: As someone who loves the command line, Iâ€™m always striving to make my workflow easier, more efficient, and just overall better. Hopefully, by walking through my set up and my recommendations for the best command line tools, youâ€™ll find some nifty tips and tricks you can adapt to make your workflow better too. The command line is a scary place if youâ€™ve never been there before. It is. You can do some really powerful and dangerous things to your computer.

item.title: Getting started with Vagrant & VVV for local development
item.description: When I started doing web development, I think I started the way a lot of us did. You have a site you want to work on, so you connect with FTP, download a file, modify it, upload it back up, and then refresh the page to see if your changes worked. This process doesnâ€™t really work when youâ€™re working with a team of people, or on a site that people are actively going to.

item.title: Setting up WordPress + Nginx + HHVM For The Fastest Possible Load Times
item.description: One of the most enjoyable parts about writing code is writing efficient andÂ performant functionality. No matter how fast your code is, if your server itself isnâ€™t running to itâ€™s maximum performance, youâ€™re not delivering your site as fast as you could be. By setting up NginxÂ and the new HHVM, you can get your server delivering fully loaded pages faster than most servers answer a request. HHVM is an open-source virtual machine designed for executing programs written in Hackand PHP.
